description: Dive into "Shop and Stroll: Kota Kinabalu's Mall Magic" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Shop and Stroll: Kota Kinabalu's Mall Magic

places.generalDescription: Imago Shopping Mall is a spacious four-level shopping destination in the heart of Kota Kinabalu, featuring a diverse range of over 300 high-end and midrange stores. The mall caters to various needs, with its Basement Mercato offering essential items while the Ground Couture floor hosts renowned fashion retailers like Micheal Kors and H&M. Additionally, visitors can enjoy dining options at the food court, restaurants, and even a karaoke bar.

sources.snippet: Let us tell you that you have just reached the best Kota Kinabalu shopping mall. We will be mentioning more details about the stores in the mall, so you can have a clear idea about it. To do: Seriously, you won‚Äôt regret going to Imago Shopping Mall where you‚Äôll have the opportunity to browse through various clothing stores and shoe stores alongside a supermarket where you can buy your grocery requirements.
sources.shortName: The 5 Best Shopping Malls in Kota Kinabalu

sources.snippet: Imago shopping mall tops the list of the best shopping places in Kota Kinabalu. This 4-level shopping mall with around 300-tenants offers its visitors a plethora of options- retail, entertainment, and dining outlets. Each floor of the mall is designed to meet the special needs of visitors like essential needs, electronics, couture, local fashion, amusements, etc.

sources.snippet: Sabah and its surrounding regions are famous for handicrafts and souvenirs made by local tribes. A few markets and shopping streets in Sabah support these indigenous groups by presenting the products, 'Tamu Market', a Sunday market, are such markets. Here, you can buy amazing local stuff like betel nuts, exotic fruits, vegetables, dried fish, sarongs, etc.

places.name: Imago Shopping Mall

reviews.text:
Like Singapore shopping mall or maybe this is newly built.  Big shopping mall, I like this place as it has many big brands shop.  Not too crowded.  The size of this shopping mall is like Woodlands Causeway point but more luxury brands than Woodlands Causeway point neighborhood shopping mall.

Nice aircon!

Imago Mall in Kota Kinabalu is a great shopping and dining destination! The mall offers many stores, from local boutiques to international brands. The food court and restaurants are highlighted, with diverse options from local cuisine to international flavors.

The food court is on the third floor, and the staff are mostly Pinoys, so language is never a barrier.

The mall's atmosphere is lively, and the staff are generally friendly. It's conveniently located, making it easy to get to. There is even a live traditional dance performance in the entrance area. Some areas offer great views, adding to the overall experience. Imago Mall is a solid choice for shopping, dining, and entertainment in Kota Kinabalu.

This is a mall that is comparable to the malls in KL and Penang. It is huge and fully occupied. There are many big brands that are represented here. There is local food as well as foreign restaurants. The mall is spacious, clean and cool. I just missed the traditional dances when I was there but I managed to see the dancers taking photos with the tourists. This is so positive.

places.address: KK Times Square, Phase 2, Off Coastal Highway, 88100 Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia

sources.snippet: The advent of national retailer store SenQ has brought a wide range of choices for TV, home theater system, projector, washing machine, refrigerator, and other domestic appliances. The major brands of laptops and PCs on display include Sony, HP, Toshiba, Acer, Asus, Twinhead, and Samsung. There are many hair salons and fashion shops for women too within the complex.

places.generalDescription: Centre Point Sabah is a bustling shopping complex located in Kota Kinabalu, offering a wide range of retail options including electronics, cosmetics, and fashion. The mall boasts an extensive selection of brand-name apparel for both men and women, along with household products and accessories. Visitors can also enjoy diverse Asian and international cuisine at the food court. Additionally, the entertainment options at Centre Point Sabah are abundant, with features such as an arcade, cinema, and bowling alley.

sources.snippet: The biggest shopping centre in town is Centre Point, a vast multi-story complex offering almost everything you could wish for, with a speciality in electronic goods. Centre Point is renowned as an exclusive retail establishment with a wide selection of brand-name men's and ladies' apparel, household products, accessories, and a food court featuring diverse Asian and international cuisine. Brands range from The Mod House, RSH, NIKE, Adidas, Giordano, Hush Puppies, Unionbay, Botton, Aussino, Levis, Clark, Vincci, to Diesel, Starbucks, and Secret Recipe.
sources.shortName: Kota Kinabalu - Shopping

reviews.text: I just love this large, old-school with many independent stores shopping mall. It's a welcome break from the modern shopping mall these days with the same old same old global brands. There's lots for tourists like me see and buy, and the whole shopping experience was just worth your "tourist time."
A nice shopping mall in kota kinabalu. Occasionally have cultural performance

ADVANTAGES: Located in the city center, Placing a food court on the ground floor with various types of food and beverage products that charge fairly reasonable prices for food and beverages. DISADVANTAGES: The surau is located on the 3rd floor in a parking area that is in poor and hot conditions. The toilet is smelly and dirty. Most premises employ workers whose citizenship status is unclear because their language and attitude are very questionable.

It is a good place to buy electrical items such as appliances and gadgets, Muslim fashion and homeware items.
places.name: Karamunsing Shopping Complex

reviews.text: Classic design shopping mall that has been here since the 90's. Famous for tech and home appliances (Laptop, pc, phone, washing machine, television etc)

Pre historic stuffs sold here. Electricals are not that cheap if you take into account you need to install it separately , like air-conditioners. Its almost a taboo thing to ask the shop for dedicated installers. Thats just my experience though. Very old building, tight spaces. But easy access to surau just beside the lift, provided you got the right lift ya.

Karamunsing Mall is a great place, especially if you're looking to repair your laptop or buy electronics, so many shops to choose from. The best part is, there are plenty of seats around, so you can sit and relax while waiting. It's comfortable, not too crowded, and everything is easy to find. Really convenient.

places.generalDescription: Nestled along the vibrant waterfront of Kota Kinabalu, Wisma Merdeka stands out as a beloved shopping destination that captures the essence of local culture. This multi-story shopping center boasts over 300 vendors, showcasing an eclectic mix of handicrafts, clothing, and delicious street food. Visitors can explore unique offerings from local artisans while also finding popular items like batik and antiques.

sources.snippet: Along the main street from Centre Point, you‚Äôll find Wisma Merdeka, another multi-story shopping centre with loads of great shops. Wisma Merdeka features mostly local sellers, giving it a unique character and merchandise profile. It‚Äôs a great place for buying clothes or souvenirs, and it is home to the best local bookshop in town ‚Äî The Borneo Shop ‚Äî and the city's largest golf shop.

30 cents to use toilet. No toilet paper supplied. 50 cents extra if you want a tiny packet of tissue. Toilet floor wet, have to turn bottom of trousers up. Only one sitting toilet, the rest are squatting toilet. Very disappointed! Already generous giving one star

Now this is the kind of mall I like! Forget those atas dime a dozen malls with no character, there are some real shops with character here. And GREAT hidden food shops on the 3rd floor.
Give the first mall ever built on Kota Kinabalu (as one shop owner informed me, it was over 30 years ago) a go!

sources.snippet: Star City Mall is a great place to buy clothing and accessories. You can find all kinds of shops, slimming and beauty salons, tuck shops, and a strip of Borneo arts & crafts stalls lining the walkway. The food court hosts popular restaurants like Fook Yuen, along with Korean, Japanese, Indian, and local eateries.

places.name: Kompleks Asia City

reviews.text:
WELCOME TO STAR CITY MALL

Star City Mall is a suitable place for shopping because it's not really crowded during the evening.
For me, I like a place which is not crowdy. Why? I have more time to select what I want to buy without disturbance.
During my visit here, I bought a box of Hair Color Conditioner with Natural Herbs to darken gray hair üòÑ. Many types of hair color I've tried but this one is really effective üëç. I bought it from Guardian.
Earlier I told the sales girl that I need hair color that can cover gray hair so she recommended me "BIGEN".

In this mall, many other businesses operates here. And while waiting for my daughters, I went down to 1st floor and walked around. I stopped by to order chicken floss cheese wafer and a cup of corn cheese and seated on a bench near a Cafe.

Star City Mall provides many benches for customers to take rest after hours of shopping. It makes this place more convenient and suitable for everyone.
Anything you can find here, boutiques, saloon, Digi Shop, Watson, Guardian, Bata, Sundry Shops, Food Court, Secret Recipe, KFC and many more shops.

ENJOY YOUR TIME DURING SEASON HOLIDAYS üòçüòçüòç.
For me it's okay because it's cheap and every places is walking distance (in the city)..  but it's not really good for those who have allergies as the room have a few dust.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è (3/5)

A Mixed Bag of Convenience and Nostalgia

Star City Mall has been around for quite some time, and it definitely carries that feeling of nostalgia for those of us who grew up seeing it evolve. Located in a fairly accessible area of Kota Kinabalu, it's not the flashiest or most modern mall in town, but it still offers a certain charm and serves its purpose for quick errands or casual visits.

The mall is relatively small compared to newer shopping centers, but it's straightforward to navigate. There's a decent mix of shops-ranging from small local businesses to mobile shops, salons, and some clothing stores. You can also find a supermarket inside, which is convenient if you live nearby and need to grab groceries without battling heavy crowds.

One of the best things about Star City is that it's usually not overcrowded, which makes it a peaceful spot to take a break. There are a few food and beverage outlets, although not many big-name brands. If you're not fussy and just need a place to relax and grab a bite, it does the job.

That said, the mall could use a facelift. Some areas look outdated and under-maintained, and a few units remain empty. Parking is generally easy, although the area can feel a bit quiet in the evenings.

Overall, Star City Mall is more of a neighborhood convenience spot than a shopping destination. It's great for quick visits, simple needs, and a dose of old-school KK vibes. Just don't expect anything fancy.

places.address: Jalan Kampung Air 5, Pusat Bandar, 88000 Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia

Situated opposite Marina Court Apartments, this mall offers a thriving urban lifestyle with various leisure activities, entertainment options, and dining pleasures. The waterfront location provides stunning sunset views, adding to the allure of the iconic nautical design. With its strategic location near hotels, commercial outlets, and business districts, Oceanus Waterfront Mall stands as Kota Kinabalu's first-ever waterfront landmark.

sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Malaysia | Things to do in Malaysia

places.name: Oceanus Waterfront Mall

reviews.text:
Looking for a great shopping and dining experience? Look no further than Oceanus Waterfront Mall. Set within the exclusive Kota Kinabalu City Waterfront (KKCW) development at the heart of the city, Oceanus Waterfront Mall is one of the city's trendiest urban lifestyle hotspots with a diverse range of shopping, dining, entertainment and leisure activities that guarantees something for everyone. Indulge in some of Kota Kinabalu's mouth-watering food and delight in its finest fashion as you explore the mall. At the end of the day, sit back, relax and take in the sight of the best sunset view the city has to offer right at our doorstep!

With ample parking spaces as well as convenient pick-up and drop off zones, Oceanus Waterfront Mall is easily accessible to tourists and locals alike! As you step into the mall, you are transported into a shopping haven that promises a marine experience. True to its name, the mall is tastefully decorated with the ocean in mind. While there, shoppers will have the opportunity to view the tallest hand-cut mosaic pillars in Malaysia, with each one featuring a marine animal that finds its home in Sabah waters.

The mall also caters to numerous events that guarantees a fun and memorable time for the family. With a great shopping experience, fun events and delectable dining, Oceanus Waterfront Mall is sure the place to be!

It all started with an idea to create an artwork that is awe-inspiring and at the same time portray a message that resonates with both locals and tourists alike. The artwork should embody the spirit of the Oceanus Waterfront Mall. It should hold great significance and it should be iconic.

Iconic it was. What resulted from a mere idea was the creation of four multi coloured hand-cut mosaic columns, known as the ‚ÄúPillars of the Sea‚Äù. Each column is approximately 18.5 meters in height and spans four floors, from the floor of the concourse level to the ceiling of the second floor. The towering height of these columns earned it the title as ‚ÄúThe Tallest Hand-Cut Mosaic Columns in Malaysia‚Äù by the Malaysian Book of Records.

The monumental task of building the Pillars of Colour was given to Penang-based Company, Sculpture At Work ‚Äì the only UNESCO award winning company in the country to have done similar kinds of hand-cut mosaic projects. However, while the company has worked with pieces on flat surfaces, this is the first time it had dealt with a curved surface. The creation of the columns took 1 year from the conception of its idea to the piecing together of every cut mosaic tile on the pillar. The images were first drawn and then computer generated. Once done, the team had to mould and cast the pillars before attempting to stick on the hand-cut mosaic tiles piece by piece.

Every piece of mosaic tiles were well thought-out and positioned. When looked at as a whole, observers will notice that certain pieces of mosaic tiles are gleaming. This is deliberately placed in order to create a 3D effect of movement. It is to simulate the movement of the sea creatures underwater.

Each column depicts one sea creature that finds its home in our waters ‚Äì the dolphin, the turtle, the jellyfish and the stingray. The depiction of these sea creatures serve to create awareness about the problems our marine life are facing due to man-made problems of pollution, overfishing and illegal poaching.

The creation of these larger-than-life images serve to remind us that our waters are home to some of the most fascinating creatures in the world, and while we are lucky to see it in our lifetimes, it may not be the case for the generations to come if we do not continue our efforts to safeguard them.

The Pillars of the Sea are the pride of the Oceanus Waterfront Mall and the pride of the people of Sabah. They are iconic pillars that will be admired for many years to come!

Really bad experience!
When car arrive,just come down from car direct had parking man come to collect parking fee Rm6 for 3 hour
Really unhappy when walk in oceanus almost 90% shop are closed!
Then anyone can tell me what point i come?
Fast inform that parking man can refund the money? That person just ignore and continue writing the parking receipt!
Good job for fast writing skill!
No more next time!
Please improve ur management!
1 star also don't want give it!

I always try to make sure that a review has a positive aspect so, here goes... If you're looking for a perfect location to lease for a post-apocalyptic paintball venue - you've found it!
I was last here about ten years ago. Then, it was a thriving international mall. Today, while it's still open with a few market stalls it's mostly derelict, looking like a scene from a video game. Bizarrely, just inside the main door, there is still a staffed information desk, which has to be the most pointless job outside of reality TV.
According to the local shopkeeper I spoke to, the place died off during COVID-19 and never recovered. A shame for such a prime location. Hopefully one day it will be resurrected.

places.address: LOT C-16&C-17, LOWER GROUND FLOOR, OCEANUS WATERFRONT MALL, 88000 Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Metrojaya is a full-fledged department store that houses beauty products, fashion accessories, perfumes, household items sport wear, children wear, etc. The different brands hosted by Metrojaya include East India Company, Living Quarters, and Somerset Bay.
sources.shortName: Shopping Tips: Malls in Kota Kinabalu

places.name: Metrojaya

reviews.text: The new-look Metrojaya outlet has opened today (11th August 2023) after renovation works.

Went to Metrojaya for baby gear preparation, ample selection and reasonable price. Staffs were there to assist you when in need. Promotion wise is good. Metrojaya do have a wide selection of payment methods as well such as Favepay, atome, PACE, DuitNow, etc..
Its ok but quite expensive. In picture is the latest logo.

places.address: LOT 1-45 B FIRST FLOOR, SURIA SABAH SHOPPING MALL, Jln Tun Fuad Stephens, Kota Kinabalu, 88000 Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: The Borneo Shop, situated on the ground floor of Wisma Merdeka shopping mall in the city center, is a haven for those seeking literature and souvenirs related to Borneo. This quaint store offers an extensive collection of novels, travel guides, books on natural history, culture, history, and cookery specific to the island. Visitors praise its fantastic service and diverse range of local souvenirs.

sources.snippet: Located on the ground floor of the Wisma Merdeka shopping mall, next to the Hyatt Hotel in the city centre, is the best bookshop in town for all things Borneo. The Borneo Shop offers novels, travel guides, popular books on the island's natural history, culture, history, and cookery, as well as a large number of specialist books.
sources.shortName: Kota Kinabalu - Shopping

sources.snippet: An array of retail shops selling different kinds of products. Facilities are also available for business purposes (arranging meetings and events); Likas Square Condotel Hotel is in the complex.
sources.shortName: Sabah Shopping Centres - Malls to shop

places.name: The Borneo Shop

reviews.text:
so many books about Sabah...a must visit if you want to find books about Sabah in term of nature and history which is  so good.
Note: I am looking for the book by Agnes Keith about Three Came Home and I found it here. ü•∞
Really nice selection of books about Borneo and beautiful souvenirs that are more unique than what you would find in other souvenir shops.
Just the best bookstore in Malaysia. Small, unique, specialised. Perfect for nature lovers and history buffs alike. Pricey, but excellent.

places.address: Wisma Merdeka, BG26, Ground Floor, Phase 2, 88000 Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Suria Sabah shopping centre, Wisma Merdeka, KK Plaza, and Segama Complex, are to mention a few. TunRazak Road is the centre for all shopping malls in Kota Kinabalu.
sources.shortName: Shopping Tips: Malls in Kota Kinabalu

places.name: Segama Complex

reviews.text: Best environment for gym that not Aircond lover like me. And most the coach here answer every question and show correct posture to carry weight. Got some more place to hang out here, coffee, light snacking also sell here.

Place for locals to shop for various items. Can be a bit hot and suffocating during the day but it is a convinient place to shop as there are lots of shops there from grocery mart to other kinds of shops. Recommended!
The is a night market below Segama overhead bridge after 5pm daily. Selling mainly food and fruits. If you looking for durian in Kota Kinabalu, here is among the place to visit.

places.address: Pusat Bandar Kota Kinabalu, 88000 Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia
